page.title: 18BRIDGE OF WEIR - FARMLAND 2
page.content: Mr Carruth's herd of{365}cows is a mixture of two breeds.One third is pure{Ayrshire}pedigree and the remainder is a mixture of pure bred {Friesian}and{Holstein.4 bulls}are kept on the farm although most calves are produced by{artificial insemination carried out by Mr Carruth. The milk herd consists of{144}cows,12 being milked at a time in the milking parlour.A daily collection by tanker is taken to{Express Dairies}in Glasgow for bottling and redistribution.A hiefer usually gives 18 litres and a cow 26.5 litres per day.The highest yielder at the moment is approaching 8000 litres in this lactation period. As milk production is presently over the{E.E.C quota},calves are feeding from their mothers until the peak lactation time of{3 weeks}instead of the usual{1-2 days.
